events.name: iOS Dev Scout April 2017 Meetup
events.description:
Venue: Singapore Power Ltd. 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #08-00 Keppel Tower 2 Singapore[masked] Speakers: • Yeo Kheng Meng - IoT engineer at Singapore Power • Vina Rianti - iOS Developer at Singapore Power • Amy Cheong - Software Engineer at Tigerspike Agenda: • 6:30pm: Come have some pizza (Sponsored by Singapore Power), say hello to other iOS devs  • 7:15pm: Distance Machine Locker - by Kheng Meng and Vina • 7:45pm: My Experiences at try! Swift Tokyo 2017 - by Amy • 8:15pm: Show & Tell, quiz with collectibles to be won! About the Topics: • Do not leave your unlocked computers unattended! One should take this advice seriously at the office of the Singapore Power’s Digital Team. Some malicious people in this department are quick to pounce on your unlocked systems to embarrass you if you leave your machine unlocked. Find out how Kheng Meng defended against this threat with a hardware device and a Swift desktop app. • Amy will be sharing her experiences during this year’s try! Swift Tokyo in March as well as presenting some follow-up researches and presenter notes on topics she finds are interesting during the conference.  



About iOS Conf SG 2016: iOS Conf SG is an annual iOS conference organised by us. Last year's conference was on the 20th and 21st of October @ Nanyang Polytechnic and it concluded with an amazing turn out, garnering raving responses and feedback from both the speakers and attendees. For more information, visit our iOS Dev Scout Group and iOS Conf SG Page: iOS Conf SG Website: http://iosconf.sg iOS Conf SG 2016 Videos: https://engineers.sg/conference/iosconfsg2016 iOS Conf SG Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/iosconfsg/ iOS Dev Scout Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/iosdevscout/
events.location: Singapore Power, 240 Tanjong Pagar, Keppel Towers 2, Level 08

events.name: Carousell Level-Up: Applying Scrum for Better Delivery Part 2.
events.description:
We had a great talk about Scrum last Tuesday with a very enthusiastic crowd of Carousell engineers and guests, including some really insightful conversations with our guests about their challenges with Agile and Scrum. We’ve got part 2 next Tuesday, and we’re looking forward to more great discussions!  

Topic: Scrum Fundamentals, Pt 2
Presenters: Jordan Dea-Mattson, Carousell VP of Engineering
Date and time: 25 April 2017, 7pm onwards
Address: 240 Tanjong Pagar Road, #12-00 Keppel Tower 2, Singapore 088540

Having gone through the overview and basics of Scrum last Tuesday, we’ll now be delving deeper into Sprint Goals, User Stories and Acceptance Criteria. You’ll learn what can be considered effective and ineffective definitions of these concepts, and the tools that can help in this process. Also, we’ll discuss how the team can have a shared understanding of what it means to be “done”.

If you’re working in engineering, product management, or just in defining and delivering products, you should come and join our talk! Food and drink will be provided, as well as good company! Hope to see you here!
events.location: Carousell HQ, 240 Tanjong Pagar Rd, #12-00, Singapore 088540

events.name: Segregated Witness vs ASICBOOST
events.description: Segregated Witness (SegWit), a bug fix for malleability, has also gained momentum as a solution for increasing the bitcoin networks bottleneck on transactions per second. Over the last year it has however been met with strong opposition. Recently ASICBOOST, an optimization against the Bitcoin mining algorithm, was confirmed to be implemented in Bitmain's mining chips. This optimization would be only of limited use after SegWit activates.  In this meetup, TenX CEO Toby Hoenisch will explain how Segregated Witness works and describe the conflict with ASICBOOST. Followed up by an open discussion on how this conflict can be resolved and how the Bitcoin community can move forward. The presentation will be followed by networking.
events.location: Paypal at Suntec , 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: April Ruby Meetup
events.description:
Hi fellow Rubyists!  Come join us for our April 2017 Ruby meetup at Spacemob, 8 Claymore Hill, #03-01, Singapore 229572 Programme 1. "Code review: do we do it right?" - Mykola Kyryk 2. "Building a Narrative Bot" - Tan Guo Xiang 3. "5 Random Ruby Tips" - Ashley Huang 4. Announcements   - This is a 5 to 10-minute session, during which anyone can stand up and share something interesting! -------------- Interested to give a talk at future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, your opinions on best practices, or projects you discovered or are working on. And we are especially friendly towards beginners! See you all soon! --------------  Thank you Sponsors! Venue  Food Sponsor  


Video Recording Many thanks to @engineersftw for video coverage!  


--------------  Organisers Winston  (@winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com)Mingding  (@hanmd82  / hanmd82@gmail.com)Guo Xiang (@tgx_world  / tgx_world@hotmail.com) Job Postings Mobile Market Monitor - "Looking to add a full-stack developer and data engineer to our Singapore office! We're a US-based tech company that utilises user travel data for transport model planning and currently working on a collaborative project with the Singapore LTA. Interns are welcome! More details here: http://bit.ly/2csrTAZ"
